intro: Draba remotiflora, commonly known as the distant-flowered rockcress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, linear leaves and produces small, white or yellowish flowers in racemes. It is native to regions of Europe, Asia, and North Africa, often found in arid or semi-arid habitats. Draba remotiflora is adapted to harsh conditions, with a short growing season and efficient water conservation mechanisms.
